Class Panel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class Panel
extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>
    a Panel for each tile in the grid

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.image.ImageView addImage(java.lang.String url)
      adds an image to the panel by loading the image from a given url
      void addNeighbours()
      goes through the main grid and adds all of the neighbours that exist around the panel to the neighbours attribute
      void calculateNeighbours()
      will calculate the bomb count by checking the neighbours of the panel
      void handle(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles click event on the panel, handles left click, right click, and double left click

      determines whether or not the tile is a bomb
      boolean isFlagged()
      determines whether the panel is flagged
      boolean isRevealed()
      determines whether the panel is revealed
      void removeImage(javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv)
      removes the Image from the panel
      void reveal()
      reveals the current tile, if the tile is blank will call revealNeighbours.
      void revealNeighbours()
      will call the reveal function on the neighbours of the current tile.
      void revealNeighbours(boolean notSafe)
      will call the reveal function on the neighbours of the current tile.
      void setBomb(boolean bomb)
      sets the tile to a bomb or not
      void setColour()
      sets the colour of the panel based on its state
      void setGame(Game game)
      sets the game attribute to the given game object
      void setGrid(Panel[][] g)
      sets the grid attribute to a given grid
      void setIsFlagged(boolean flagged)
      sets the panel to be flagged or not
      void setIsRevealed(boolean revealed)
      sets the panel to be revealed or not
      void setText()
      sets the text of the tile to the bomb count of the panel, or to nothing if the panel is a bomb or is not revealed.
      void update()
      updates the panel

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Handles click event on the panel, handles left click, right click, and double left click
        Specified by:
        handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - event that calls the function

      • reveal

        public void reveal()
        reveals the current tile, if the tile is blank will call revealNeighbours. will end the game if the tile is a bomb

      • revealNeighbours

        public void revealNeighbours(boolean notSafe)
        will call the reveal function on the neighbours of the current tile. Avoiding a tile if it is a bomb, revealed, or flagged.
        Parameters:
        notSafe - if true the function will call reveal on bombs as well.

      • revealNeighbours

        public void revealNeighbours()
        will call the reveal function on the neighbours of the current tile. Avoiding a tile if it is a bomb, revealed, or flagged.

      • calculateNeighbours

        public void calculateNeighbours()
        will calculate the bomb count by checking the neighbours of the panel

      • addNeighbours

        public void addNeighbours()
        goes through the main grid and adds all of the neighbours that exist around the panel to the neighbours attribute

      • update

        public void update()
        updates the panel

      • setColour

        public void setColour()
        sets the colour of the panel based on its state

      • setText

        public void setText()
        sets the text of the tile to the bomb count of the panel, or to nothing if the panel is a bomb or is not revealed.

      • isBomb

        public boolean isBomb()
        determines whether or not the tile is a bomb
        Returns:
        true if the tile is a bomb, false otherwise

      • setBomb

        public void setBomb(boolean bomb)
        sets the tile to a bomb or not
        Parameters:
        bomb - true to set to a bomb, false otherwise.

      • isRevealed

        public boolean isRevealed()
        determines whether the panel is revealed
        Returns:
        true if revealed, false otherwise.

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged()
        determines whether the panel is flagged
        Returns:
        true if flagged, false otherwise

      • setGrid

        public void setGrid(Panel[][] g)
        sets the grid attribute to a given grid
        Parameters:
        g - a 2D array of panels that is the grid

      • setGame

        public void setGame(Game game)
        sets the game attribute to the given game object
        Parameters:
        game - a game object

      • setIsRevealed

        public void setIsRevealed(boolean revealed)
        sets the panel to be revealed or not
        Parameters:
        revealed - true to reveal, false otherwise

      • setIsFlagged

        public void setIsFlagged(boolean flagged)
        sets the panel to be flagged or not
        Parameters:
        flagged - true to set flagged, false otherwise

      • addImage

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView addImage(java.lang.String url)
        adds an image to the panel by loading the image from a given url
        Parameters:
        url - the url path to the file
        Returns:
        the imgView with the image added to it

      • removeImage

        public void removeImage(javafx.scene.image.ImageView iv)
        removes the Image from the panel
        Parameters:
        iv - the imageView to be removed
